title: A Family's Christmas Problem with Home Insulation
summary: Tony and Becs Wadley cannot spend Christmas at home because insulation installed in their house caused black mould, making it unsafe for their son Elliott, who has asthma. They got a government grant to make their home warmer to help Elliott, but the insulation led to mould growth in several rooms. Elliott has not been able to live in the house since April and stays with his grandmother. The family will stay with relatives for Christmas to be together. Many other people have reported similar problems with insulation in their homes. The government says it is working to fix these issues and improve the system so families are not let down.

background_read: This article is about a family who cannot celebrate Christmas at home because insulation installed with government help caused black mould, making it unsafe for their asthmatic son. It shows how home improvements can sometimes go wrong and affect families' lives. Many other people have similar problems, and the government is trying to fix the system to prevent this in the future. It highlights the importance of safe housing and family togetherness during holidays.
